intro: Hieracium interspersum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright stems and basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite flower heads, which are made up of many small florets. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions. Hieracium interspersum is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in some areas.
